0: Amazon is planning on significantly expanding its line of hardware devices, Greg Bensinger at the Wall Street Journal reports. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Previously, there was a report Amazon was developing a video streaming box that rivals Apple TV and Roku. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR If all of these reports are accurate, Amazon is going to have quite the suite of hardware products. The 3D screen on this high-end smartphone would not require glasses. Images would appear to float on the screen like a hologram, says Bensinger. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR You never want to pre-judge a product that doesn't exist, but this sounds really bad. It sounds like a mess of horrendous gimmicks. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR There is no value in a 3D screen. HTC made a phone with a 3D screen, the EVO 3D. It didn't come out with a second 3D phone, which tells you all you need to know. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR When HTC failed to follow with a second 3D phone, an HTC rep explained the decision to CNET, saying, "I wouldn't say 3D was necessarily dead, I mean never say never, but we don't have any new products with 3D in the lineup. That's based partially on customer feedback, what we know the market wants, and also a design decision we've made." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR As for eye-tracking, Samsung is trying that and it's not working. Amazon has failed to produce great software, so we see little-to-no chance that its going to do good eye tracking software. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The smartphone market is very crowded. Amazon understandbly wants to roll out a smartphone that stands out from the crowd. 3D screens and eye tracking are not the best way to stand out. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR If Amazon really wants to do something great with the smartphone it should focus on data plan pricing.
